text: Richland Creek is a stream in Callaway County in the U.S. state of Missouri. It is a tributary of Crows Fork Creek. The stream headwaters arise just south of Interstate 70 north of the community of Earl at . The stream flows southeast and crosses under Missouri Route 54 north of Fulton and reaches its confluence with Maddox Branch to form Crows Fork Creek northeast of Fulton at .Missouri Atlas & Gazetteer, DeLorme, 1998, First edition, p. 38 Richland Creek was named for the richness of the soil along its course. ==See also== *List of rivers of Missouri ==References== Category:Rivers of Callaway County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Missouri
title: Richland Creek (Crows Fork Creek tributary)
